intro: Tetramolopium lanatum, commonly known as the woolly tetramolopium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. Its leaves are covered in dense white or grayish hairs, giving it a woolly appearance, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Tetramolopium lanatum is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
